newsitem.title: INDIA: India's rulers given deadline to answer Congress.
newsitem.headline: India's rulers given deadline to answer Congress.

text.p: India's ruling United Front coalition said the Congress party had given it until 3 p.m. (0930 GMT) on Thursday to respond to its demand that Prime Minister H.D. Deve Gowda step down.
"Talks have not failed yet," United Front leader Ram Vilas Paswan told reporters. "We have time until 3 p.m."
Paswan said the United Front was prepared to discuss policy issues and coordination with Congress, but the leadership issue was "non-negotiable".
Congress spokesman Vithal Gadgil confirmed that his party had issued instructions to members to vote against Deve Gowda in a vote of confidence on Friday.
Tariq Anwar, political secretary to Congress president Sitaram Kesri, said: "We stand by our demand for change in leadership. The talks have failed."
But Gadgil said he did not know if another round of talks would be held to try to resolve the political impasse.
